definition[0]: on a ship, plane, or spacecraft
example[0]: There are 12 children on board the ship.
definition[1]: involved with something or working for an organization
example[1]: Supporters of the treaty say that it will be necessary to have the United States on board.
example[2]: He came on board in the late sixties and spent two decades with the agency.
definition[2]: carried on a ship, plane, car etc
